name: The Backrooms: Game Boy Edition
description:
Inspired by the popular 4chan "the backrooms" post.

If you're not careful and noclip out of reality in the wrong areas, you'll end up in the Backrooms, where it's nothing but the stink of old moist carpet, the madness of mono-yellow, the endless background noise of fluorescent lights at maximum hum-buzz, and approximately six hundred million square miles of randomly segmented empty rooms to be trapped in.

God save you if you hear something wandering around nearby, because it sure as hell has heard you.

Game Story:

Three [Redacted] research team members have gone missing inside [Redacted]. 

Your team has been tasked with locating, and if possible, extracting the missing team members back through the [Redacted].        

Good luck.

Features:

  • Nintendo's Game Boy inspired graphics, sound and screen resolution.
  • Random object and enemy spawning make it a fresh experience each play through.
  • Noclipping mechanic. (Bumping into walls has a chance of noclipping into level -1.)
  • Multiple levels. ( -1, 0, 1, 2, and more!)
  • Multiple Entities. ( Smilers, Death Moths, Partygoers, and more!)

Controls:

W,A,D,S = Move

Spacebar = Interact

Holding down 'N' and bumping into walls = Possibility to Noclip

Dev Note:

Please let me know if you find any bugs or have any issues running the game. I tried to catch as many bugs as I could during development, and will continue to polish and release new content for it in the coming months.

-Permafried Games
